level.text: 6311.1 The Board shall issue a license by endorsement to an occupationalherapist or an occupational therapy assistant who has a valid unrestrictedicense in good standing from another jurisdiction of the United States and whoeets all other requirements of this section.
6311.2 An applicant for licensure as an occupational therapist or anccupational therapist assistant by endorsement shall submit with a completedpplication the following:
Official, certified proof of active licensure in at least one (1)urisdiction;
Proof of good standing from all jurisdictions in which the occupational therapist ever held a license in the United States;

Official, certified proof, from the body administering the examination,hat the applicant has passed the Board-approved occupational therapy or occupational therapy assistant national licensure examination (as relevant to the license); and
Proof that the applicant is a graduate of a professional occupationalherapy

or occupational therapy assistant education program, as relevant to the license, accredited by an agency that the United States Department of Education recognizes for that purpose, or that the Board approves.
